intro: Mancoa bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or mancoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow up to several meters in height. Its bracts are thick and velvety, providing a distinctive appearance. Mancoa bracteata is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
